title: Leighton Meester Just Wore a Gorgeous Sheer Gown on the Red Carpet With Adam Brody
The Most Dazzling Red Carpet Looks From the 2025 Critics Choice Awards
Calvin Klein’s first female creative director finds succour in a fictional New York
description: Veronica Leoni’s first collection mixed hat-tips to the CK archive with the Italian’s own ‘dreams of America’Calvin Klein’s first female creative director, Veronica Leoni, presented her debut collection on Friday, watched on by Kate Moss – the brand’s most famous face during the 1990s, when its billboard ads ruled the zeitgeist – Calvin Klein himself, 82, and Christy Turlington.The brand had a lot riding on Friday’s show, its first catwalk presentation for six and a half years, and the highlight of a New York fashion week schedule that has been light on big names as American fashion struggles to compete with European brands owned by the French conglomerates LVMH and Kering. Continue reading...
author: Hannah Marriott

title: Buckle up! The return of grown-up trousers means belts are back | Jess Cartner-Morley on fashion
description: The versatility of the humble belt can give the clothes you already own a new, stylish lease of lifeThere is a white-hot, brand new must-have accessory in fashion. Long, snakey object that goes around your waist, sometimes holds your trousers up. It’s called a belt. Perhaps you’ve heard of it?Sometimes shifts in style are so simple that you don’t notice them. The return of the belt is like that. Everyone owns a belt and knows what it is. A belt isn’t eyecatching, which means that when someone walks past you in the street wearing a belt, your eye doesn’t necessarily even register it in the way you would clock, say, a cowboy hat, or a corsage. But the belt is big fashion news this season. It is a style hack that can give your favourite coat an instant makeover; unlock a new silhouette when teamed with a pair of trousers; and turn basics into an outfit. Continue reading...
author: Jess Cartner-Morley

author: Josh Sims

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style Will Inspire Your Next Outfit
description: It’s early February, which means our bodies (and minds) are officially over the winter chill and dreary skies. But, thankfully, New York Fashion Week — and its flurry of eye-catching street style looks — is here to lift our moods. From February 6 to 11, the most fashion-forward creators, celebrities, designers, editors, and industry insiders are taking to the NYC streets. And by the looks coming out of the New York Fashion Week fall/winter 2025 shows, they are dressing to impress — or at least leave a mark on our IG feeds. The wide array of street style outfits offer a fresh, inviting perspective on how we’ll be able to wear the year’s budding trends moving into spring. Wondering how to experiment with suiting, all-monochrome looks, and infuse color into your wardrobe? There’s a NYFW street style look ready to give you some inspo. So, keep scrolling to discover some of our favorites.  Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Photographed by Flordalis Espinal.Like what you see? author: Patricia Karounos

title: For Petites: Finally, A Fashion Collection That Doesn’t Require Alterations
description: Floor-dragging hemlines. Comically disproportionate silhouettes. Too-low knee placements (see also: darts, and waistbands, and necklines). Rises so high, they span the entire length of your torso. Long coats that pool at the feet. These are just a few of the many, many sartorial challenges that petites face — but all of that is addressed in JCPenney’s latest fashion collaboration: Bold Elements x Ally Brooke, a collection done in partnership with the award-winning singer-songwriter (you might remember her from Fifth Harmony) that delivers petite-forward, fashion-fueled styles.  “At 5’0”, I know firsthand how often petite women are overlooked — and how difficult it can be to find fashion that fits. I wanted to work with JCPenney to break down those barriers in fashion and create a collection that fits and flatters all body types,” Brooke says. “What makes this collection so special is that it’s not straight-sized clothing that happens to offer petite, it’s petite clothing that happens to offer straight sizing. The difference is so apparent in the pieces.”  This thoughtful, considered approach to design that benefits *everyone* (from petites to straight size and plus size) is evident in all 29 pieces, but Brooke calls out two styles in particular: long trench coats and Bermuda shorts, saying “trend-forward fashion [like these] often aren’t realistic options for petites like me, but this collection offers stylish, proportional designs made for petite and plus-sized women.” Her other favorites include a top featuring a pattern of her actual lip print, along with the black blazer styled with the pinstripe pants. “Many people wear a combination of petite and standard sizes, and I love that you can mix and match styles and sizes to fit your own vibe — no alterations required.”  View this post on Instagram A post shared by Refinery29 (@refinery29) And to keep the big fashion energy going, JCPenney hosted an unforgettable event during New York Fashion Week to not only celebrate the launch of the Bold Elements x Ally Brooke collection, but also to announce the Petite Power List, which honors eight influential petite women, including Brooke, who are making waves in their industries: April Lockhart, an advocate for the disability community; Averie Bishop, a social activist and cofounder of the Tulong Foundation nonprofit; Shan Berries, CEO and founder of Shades by Shan Cosmetics; April Whitney, a certified personal trainer and founder of Petite PWR; Eli Rallo, a content creator and author of I Didn’t Know I Needed This; Imani Ellis, CEO and founder of CultureCon and The Creative Collective; and Armani Latimer, a Dallas Cowboys cheerleader who has embraced her alopecia and inspires others to do the same.  “I know that size means nothing when it comes to showing up in big ways and making an impact in life. [That’s why] I’m excited to work with JCPenney to announce the “Petite Power List,” Brooke says. “I’m so excited to help all women, but especially petites, find their big fashion energy.” Prices quoted from February 6, 2025; check jcpenney.com for current pricing and discounts. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?
author: Andrea Cheng

title: Meghan Markle's Sweatshirt Has a Sweet Nod to Her Children - Shop It Here
description: Meghan Markle already has a reputation for incorporating thoughtful design flourishes into her wardrobe; over the years, she's subtly channeled Princess Diana's infamous style, frequently worn pieces from woman-owned brands like Cuyana and Birdies, and even been spotted wearing an eternity ring encrusted with Markle's own birthstone, along with those of her husband, Prince Harry, and their firstborn child, Archie. Now, in her latest Instagram post, the former royal gave fans a glimpse of yet another style that cleverly pays homage to her family - and keeps her kiddos feeling close. ICYMI: Markle took to Instagram earlier in the week to share a video in which she spoke about her ongoing efforts to support the victims of the Altadena wildfire in Los Angeles, as well as thanked Billie Eilish for helping her surprise a 15-year-old fan whose home had been destroyed by the Eaton Fire. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Meghan, Duchess of Sussex (@meghan) In the video, Markle is wearing what appears to be a simple black sweatshirt with blue jeans and her go-to Cartier watch - aka the perfect off-duty look. But upon further examination, attentive fashion girlies (like myself) noticed a unique detail that sets her top apart from the usual crewneck: embroidered cursive text along the collar that reads "Archie & Lili", the names of Markle's two children. The thoughtful Club Chainstitch Adult Chainstitch Sweatshirt ($73) is not only a sweet nod to Markle's two kiddos, but it also comes from a woman-owned small business in Chicago, Club Chainstitch. The bestselling sweatshirt can be easily customized on the brand's site, giving shoppers the option to choose their text choice, placement, and the letter coloring. Shop the Meghan Markle-approved wardrobe essential below, and for more fashion inspiration from the star, read through our guide of Markle's style evolution.
author: Kyley Warren

title: 25 Jewelry Finds From Amazon That Look Exceptionally Luxe
description: Looking for a new piece of jewelry to add to your collection or gift to your best friend? What about a classic pair of hoop earrings to elevate an outfit? Or perhaps you prefer something more personalized, like an initial pendant necklace. No matter what you're looking for, we're willing to bet you can find it on Amazon, not to mention for a super-low price. The digital retailer has options from both affordable and designer jewelry brands (see: Swarovski and Tory Burch, among others), plus a mix of on-trend styles and timeless designs for everyone, regardless of taste. If you've landed here because you're looking for a specific piece of jewelry, we found options in all sorts of categories, from anklets to cute, affordable earrings. Two designs we encourage you to scope out? An open-twist eternity band from Pandora that's minimalist, modern, and one-of-a-kind, and the layered M Mooham Store Initial Necklace, which dresses up any outfit and looks luxe. Worth noting: both designs cost under $50 and have a cult following of shoppers who attest that they're great. What more could you ask for, really? If you want to check out the complete list, keep scrolling to see our 25 favorite Amazon jewelry finds for the season that are worth adding to your jewelry box stat.
author: Marisa Petrarca
